result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J Derrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid in full by 04-15-2016 or serve 4 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Bradley J Derrick in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  
Victim notification has been complied with.
Defendant has completed up front anger management.

State moves to amend from a Felony to a Misdemeanor.
Amended Information Filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $479
To be paid in full by:  04/15/16
Alternate: 4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
